sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"基础"之意。
means: base ： 侧重指构成或支撑某一具体物体的基础，也可指军事基地或用作比喻意义。
basis ： 主要用作抽象或引申意义。
foundation ： 用于具体意义时，侧重指坚固结实的建筑物的基础或地基；用作比喻意义时，与basis基本相同。
ground ： 含义与basis和foundation接近。一般指某种决定、论点或关系的基础，也可指某种原因的基础。

word_mean: 第九局击倒全柱的好球
承受结构物荷载的岩体、土体。

sentence.Network_cn: 我决定在这个坚实的基础之上继续努力。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French fondation, from Latin fundatio(n-), from fundare 'to lay a base for' (see found)

encyclopedia.content: Foundation类层次 Foundation类层次的根是NSObject类，它（和NSObject及NSCopying协议一起）定义了基本的对象属性和行为。 Foundation框架的剩余部分由几组相互关联的类和一些独立的类组成。有一些代表基本数据类型的类，如字符串、字节数组、用于存储其它对象的集合类；一些代表系统信息的类，如日期类；还有一些代表系统实体的类，比如端口、线程、和进程。图1、图2、和图3所示的类层次描述了这些类的逻辑分组及其继承关系。 Fo

entry.def: The foundation of something such as a belief or way of life is the things on which it is based.

example.ex: Best friends are the foundation of my life...
example.tran: 好朋友是我生命的支柱。

example.ex: The issue strikes at the very foundation of our community...
example.tran: 这个问题严重影响了我们社会的基本根基。

entry.def: The foundations of a building or other structure are the layer of bricks or concrete below the ground that it is built on.
A foundation is an organization which provides money for a special purpose such as research or charity.
If a story, idea, or argument has no foundation, there are no facts to prove that it is true.

example.ex: Each complaint is analysed very closely, and if it has no foundation it is rejected.
example.tran: 每个投诉都经过仔细分析，如果发现没有依据就会予以驳回。

entry.def: Foundation is a skin-coloured cream that you put on your face before putting on the rest of your make-up.

means.word_mean: 1. the basis on which something is grounded;

sentences.sentence: "there is little foundation for his objections"

means.word_mean: 2. an institution supported by an endowment
3. the fundamental assumptions from which something is begun or developed or calculated or explained;

sentences.sentence: "the whole argument rested on a basis of conjecture"
"it was built on a base of solid rock"
"he stood at the foot of the tower"

means.word_mean: 5. education or instruction in the fundamentals of a field of knowledge;

sentences.sentence: "he lacks the foundation necessary for advanced study"

means.word_mean: 6. a woman's undergarment worn to give shape to the contours of the body
7. the act of starting something for the first time; introducing something new;

sentences.sentence: "she looked forward to her initiation as an adult"
"the foundation of a new scientific society"
"he regards the fork as a modern introduction"

means.word_mean: 建立, 设立, 创办，创建

sentences.en: The foundation of the university took place 600 years ago.
sentences.cn: 这所大学是600年前创办的。

means.word_mean: 基础, 基本原理, 根据

sentences.en: The foundation of democracy is the will of the people to preserve liberty.
sentences.cn: 民主的基础在于人民维护自由的意志。

sentences.en: The foundations of the building settled.
The Foundation gives money to help artists.
sentences.cn: 那家基金会捐款帮助艺术家。
